content.text:
You are a customer of a travel agency. Here is a description of the details of the travel you want to make:

WHAT: Travel
FROM: Cologne
TO: Stuttgart
BY: Overnight bus
CLASS: The most comfortable
WHEN: Anytime next week

The travel agent does not know about it yet. 

Questions from the travel agent will start with TRAVEL-AGENT. Please reply in the form: ANSWER: <one sentence>

I will also ask you questions. These questions will start with ME: . Please answer these questions with: ASIDE: <one sentence>

Important: Give short, direct answers!

Let us start.
Ok.
ME:  Have you informed the travel agent about the place of departure? Answer this question with yes or no and then stop.

content.thinking:
The travel agent hasn't been informed about anything yet, as stated in the instructions: "The travel agent does not know about it yet."

The question asks if I've informed the travel agent about the place of departure (Cologne). Since no conversation with the travel agent has happened yet, I haven't informed them about any details including the departure location.

The question starts with "ME:" so I should respond with "ASIDE:" followed by my answer.

Since I haven't informed the travel agent about anything, my answer should be "no".

content.text: ASIDE: No.
